fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:
- Run a random filter in JIRA to grab some issues;
- Click on _Views -> On dashboard_;
- Click in "Created vs. Resolved chart";
- Click on the 'cog' icon -> Edit

h3. Current behavior:
Many text content are using a larger font than the select field:
!ondemand-firefox.png!

h3. Expected behavior:
The text font should fit on the select field.

The same page on Chrome:
!ondemand-chrome.png!
fields.summary: Poor rendering gadget page on JIRA OnDemand with Firefox
Unable to Login to OnDemand after an Import due to PermGen OutOfMemory Error

fields.description:
We have an OD instance that is repeatedly OOME'ing due to [this List in {{MailThreadManagerImpl.extractMessageIdsFromReferences()}} | https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRA/repos/jira/browse/jira-components/jira-core/src/main/java/com/atlassian/jira/mail/MailThreadManagerImpl.java#246] accumulating many millions of Strings. 

Click for [heap dump|https://logger-02.ash1.uc-inf.net/hoop/heapdump/crustpizza.jira.com-jira-13887-201301211126.tgz?user.name=hadoop&] and [OOME event info|http://go.atlassian.com/ejwsk].

Looks like {{extractMessageIdsFromReferences()}} is broken if the argument doesn't include a closing angle bracket — which, as far as I can tell, violates [rfc2822|http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc2822.html], but does seem to be occurring in production in this case, where the value is: {{<20130120014306.G}}

With such a value, the List fills up with empty String Objects until the instance OOMEs.
fields.summary: MailThreadManagerImpl can cause repeated OOMEs if inbound message has corrupt References header

fields.description:
*Steps to produce*:
# Create at least 5 projects.
# On iPad running the latest iOS 6.1 (Safari and Chrome), on the quick issue creation, select the first project, then select the 4th or the 5th.

*Results*
# It will stuck between the first and the second everytime the user change the the project which makes it hard to reach the last projects.
fields.summary: Not possible to change projects on iPad
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError thrown in issue collector

fields.description:
Using the Jira Issue collector feedback form by adding the JavaScript as part of your web app has a problem with iPad (both big one and iPad mini) with iOS 7. 
The feedback icon appears normally on the app/web page and by clicking it the JIRA feedback form appears as we have defined it and as a user you can start inputting data into the form (by using Safari browser, iPad native web browser AS WELL AS Google chrome, latest version).

The problem is that when you want to edit the text you are writing (eg. in description field) and you want to go back in your text by tapping the cursor to some position in the already written text, the cusor moves there but you are NOT able to edit (i.e. type or delete) the text. The only way to edit is to tap outside the input field and then tap back to the text you want to edit - and then it is possible to edit the text normally. In general it seems to be a focus problem.

On iPad mini, we have also been reported that by trying to fill in the feedback form it has crashed the whole application / browser session and re-login to our system was needed to continue using our service. So, the issue is more serious on iPad mini.

We have received this feedback from several of our users complaining that the feedback link/form is unusable with iPad and refused to use it as it is. 

I hope you can validate and repeate the issue and be able to fix it ASAP, as the user feedback is of highest priority for us (as for you, I hope).

We are using JIRA OnDemand: JIRA v6.2-OD-09-036

BR,

Paulus Carpelan
paulus@quattrofolia.com
fields.summary: Editing text on the Jira Issue collector feedback form (JS you can add to your web app) does not work with iPAD properly

fields.description:
h3. Symptom
The application navigator (top-left 'hotdog' drop-down menu) is missing link to Confluence, causing users to be unable to navigate to Confluence.  If you go to https:[url]/wiki, Confluence loads, but there is no app navigator to get to other applications.

In Confluence Admin, System Add-ons, the Atlassian Navigation Links Plugin is disabled, and there is no option to enable it.

h3. Workaround
Contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com], who can restart both JIRA and Confluence, which reloads that plugin.
fields.summary: Confluence Application Navigator is missing, app navigator missing from Confluence

The reset password page looks like the attached screenshot. We should fix this.

fields.description:
Tested with 'Flowdock for JIRA' plugin v. 1.60.1

After project key rename Flowdock plugin loses the setting for 'Flowdock API token' for that project. It seems the 'Configure Flowdock integration in JIRA' page stores project keys and matches projects them with. 

Workaround is to put the token once again after rename. 

!Selection_013.png!
fields.summary: Flowdock for JIRA plugin loses API token setting after project key rename

fields.description:
h2. Symptom

JIRA Imports fail with:

User Management migration task fail: SocketTimeOutException. (see screenshot).

This affects imports into instances that UM enabled.

h2. Analysis
User Management may require more than 10 seconds to migrate all users.

The timeout cases JIRA to show the import fail screen (See screenshot), which is a false failure.  

In the logs: the migration reports successful migration had taken place.
fields.summary: Importer fails with User Migration Timeout.

Version Atlassian JIRA v6.0-OD-14-WN
I'm trying to link two issues. 
On the Link dialogue there is no field to the right of 'Issue' and the hyperlink labeled 'search for an issue' does not do anything.

I therefore cannot link issues.

I'm using FireFox version 21.0 on Windows 7.

I've just tested this with IE 9 and I don't get this error. So it is only an issue with Firefox.

fields.description: The order in which data gets displayed in the email notifications seems to have changed. For instance, the issue details would always get displayed first, followed by the comment. Since the last release, the comment gets displayed first, followed by the issue details.
fields.summary: Mail notification layout on comments rearranged

fields.description:
If you have a multi-select field for users, then concurrent additions to the field can clash with each other.  This may apply to non-users too.

To reproduce:
* Create a project with a "team-members" field, which is a multi-select user field
* Create an issue in that project.
* Have two users: "Kenny" and "Don" view the issue.
* Don adds 3 users to the team: "Kenny", "Glenn" and "Peggy"
* Kenny adds 1 user to the team: "Kenny"
** This removes "Glenn" and "Peggy" from the team.
fields.summary: Adding a user to a multi-select can remove users added in another window

It seems that you have tried to perform an illegal workflow operation."


Affects: JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions 2.5.5.1
fields.summary: "Only Assignee Condition" seems broken in JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions plugin

fields.description:
This is continuing on from JRA-29417, as it doesn't appear to be fixed. Customers are [still having the issue|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/147647/how-to-remove-expired-product-licenses-from-default-application-access].

The workaround is still the same, visit the Default Application Access page (or directly at https://instance/secure/admin/user/EditDefaultApplicationAccess!default.jspa if your instance is JIRA-only) and click "Update" to re-save the default access settings.
fields.summary: JIRA Invite plugin should ignore all unlicensed apps

fields.description:
STRM: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/STRM-2152

*Summary*
Since the update for JIRA6-OD9, the attachments preview/comments are not visible in the *Activity Stream* (please refer to {{jira_6-od_9.png}}).

*Steps to produce*:
# Create any ticket.
# Attache any image to the ticket (put a comment also).

*Actual Results*:
The attachments preview/comments are not visible in the *Activity Stream* (please refer to {{jira_6-od_9.png}}).

*Expected Results*:
It should show the image preview and the comments when attaching the image in the same manner as JIRA 5.2.x. (please refer to {{jira_5.2.8.png}}).
fields.summary: Image preview in the Activity Stream is broken

fields.description:
If a description has been added to a User Picker custom field, this description will not be displayed properly on pop up issue screens (eg. Create and Edit dialogs). The plain text will always have

tags around it, and any Wiki markup will not be rendered. Other custom fields such as a normal Text field do render correctly. Comparison.png shows normal text without any formatting. Comparison2.png shows text with the tags \{color:blue} used.
fields.summary: Description of the User Picker custom field does not display formatted text

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* Create an example project, remove everything from the "Administrators" project role.
* Create an issue collector in that project.
* Try to edit the issue collector after saving it, and you'll get a page with nothing but a warning saying "Errors".
* If you go into the "Issue Collectors" overview in JIRA's main admin screen, it claims there's no collectors created.
fields.summary: Issue Collector breaks if the user creating it doesn't have project administrator privileges for the project it's being created in

fields.description:
When I click on the link in the banner the base URL does not get updated.

!baseurl.png!

Looks like the request is returning a 401 unauthorized. Note that I am logged in as a sysadmin.
fields.summary: "Update JIRA's base URL" banner not working

fields.description:
Xref: [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-75308]

Section 10.4.2 of RFC 2616 provides that clients can infer that they've provided the wrong credentials when:

a) they get back a 'WWW-Authenticate' challenge for some scheme
b) they already provided credentials for that scheme in the request

However, the REST API currently thwarts this inference by responding with a challenge only for the 'OAuth' scheme, even though the request provided an 'Authorization' header for the 'Basic' scheme.

The only valid inference the client can make is therefore "I'm using the wrong scheme", and not "I'm using the wrong credentials".

Which caused me a support call, and our mutual time, lately.
fields.summary: REST API 401 responses should challenge for Basic auth, especially when Basic credentials were supplied in the request.

- Design a workflow in the workflow designer, and save it.
- After saving all the transition lines are not well organized per designed, and it needs to be rearranged to be well presented.

*Steps to Reproduce*
- Create an issue
- Resolve that issue
- View the issue at: https://<company>.atlassian.net/browse/<issue key>
- Select the Transitions Summary tab

*Expected Outcome*
- A list of user's names and links is shown

- A list of HTML markup is shown

The applet will load, ask you to update your JAVA plugin (even if you've previously done this), then not paste a captured screenshot. I reproduced this on the latest version of OSX and the latest version of Firefox.

The work around here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Unable+to+Attach+Images+Using+the+Screenshot+Applet+in+Firefox worked neither for me nor the customer.

*+Workaround:+*
Use the HTML5 version: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.plugins.jira-html5-attach-images

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*
# Find issue that's displayed on a dashboard (in a _Filter Results_ gadget)
# Transition the issue from the dashboard using the issues Cog Dropdown
# Use a transition that doesn't have screen specified

*Actual Result*
Transition takes a long time (+5sec) and the following screen is shown:
!filterResult.png!

***The *transition is executed* but the screen becomes frozen.

*Expected Result*
Transition is executed and Dashboard is refresh (what happens when transition has a screen)

*Temporary workaround*
Open the issue from the issue navigator and transition it from there.
fields.summary: Filter Result Gadget gives an error when trying to transition an issue

fields.description: See screenshot of a set of sub-tasks. Notice one is listed as "Closed". This was still visible after repeated attempts to select the "Show Open" button that used to work before some recent update...

fields.description:
After upgrading to 6.3-OD-1 with a restart, scheduled jobs registered from plugins are no longer registered successfully.

The System/Services page used to show a lot of scheduled services. But it only shows 2 or 3 now, e.g., "Comments from emails", "Backup Service", "Mail Queue Service".

It does not affect 6.2.1

# Within 'Import & Export' section, click 'Bitbucket Import' link
# Click 'Next' button

fields.summary: Clicking "action" on the User Screen in IE8 Results in the Menu Vanishing Intermittently

fields.description:
Hi all,

In search as it stands if you make a custom filter to include certain components the search is based on the 'String' entry of the Component.

If the Component name is amended then the search filter no longer works. You then have to edit the filter appropriate to find new components.

Search should use the ID of the component when saved so any changes to the String do not affect other filters.
fields.summary: Search filter should use Component ID instead of Component String

fields.description:
The OnDemand Importer is currently too lenient and allows XML imports to contain issues that have
* same issue num ("2" in the following example)
* same project ID  ("10000" in the following example)

{noformat}
  id   |  pkey   | project |        created         
-------+---------+---------+------------------------
 10002 | ICNET-2 |   10000 | 2011-03-22 21:20:36+11
 10040 | BZI-2   |   10000 | 2011-03-16 22:16:48+11
{noformat}

That inconsistency will cause the upgrade task introduced in JIRA 6.1-OD-3 to fail (see [this JRADEV|https://jdog.atlassian.net/browse/JRADEV-23171]  for more details), and *will prevent JIRA from starting up until the database is manually fixed by Support*.

The expected behaviour if for the importer to fail fast when such data is detected in the import file.
fields.summary: The OnDemand Importer needs to check for issues with same issueNum and projectId, and fail if it finds any.

fields.description:
Occasionally several members of my team have come across cases of the green checkmark not showing up on resolved sub-tasks.

I've attached an image, which I think shows very clearly that something is not right.
fields.summary: Missing green checkmark from some resolved sub-tasks

fields.description:
If a Workflow has a post function that references a Custom Field and that Custom Field has been deleted, the following text appears in the Workflow editor:
{noformat}
Type: class
Class: com.googlecode.jsu.workflow.function.UpdateIssueCustomFieldPostFunction
Arguments:
field.value = Value
field.name = customfield_10301
{noformat}

However, this step which no longer works cannot be deleted from the Workflow Editor.

This can be a problem for example in OnDemand where Administrators cannot do workflow imports. This is also related to [JRA-27775].

*Workaround*
Disable the plugin providing the function (in this example the *JIRA Suite Utilities* plugin), and this will allow you to delete the Post Functions and/or Validators referencing the deleted custom field.
fields.summary: Can't delete a Workflow Post function if the custom field it references has been deleted.

fields.description:
*Current Behaviour:*
Resizing the browser window allows overlap with the 'Create Issue' button.
Once reaching the end of the menu item, 'eazyBI Reports' in the attached example, the menu resizes correctly and creates the 'More' menu option.

*Expected Behaviour:*
Resizing the browser window performs the resize before overlapping the menu item.

Recorded in OnDemand, appears to occur with multiple add-ons enabled with menu bar options.
Reproduced in Chrome and Firefox
fields.summary: Menu bar resizing occurs after overlap of menu option

fields.description: I get this http://cl.ly/image/1n011L2f1z24 when I create an issue, assign it to someone, then create a new one issue and I put this unassigned, the issue is created, but an error is shown regardless the fact the operation was successfully completed.
fields.summary: java null pointer exception
Two 'Plugins' menu items in the JIRA OnDemand administration menu

fields.description:
On the view issue page of the parent issue, if an action is done on a sub-task via the cog wheel, then it scrolls to the top of the page. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Go to the View issue page of an issue which has subtasks.
2. Scroll down to the Subtasks sections.
3. From the cogwheel corresponding to a subtask, perform an action.
Notice the page scroll up.

Expected Result:
The control or page view still stays in the subtasks section.
fields.summary: Cog-Wheel action on a subtask in the view issue page causes scroll to the top

fields.description:
Users member of a group which has 'Can Use' Confluence global permission, but hasn't 'JIRA Users' JIRA global permission, don't have their login details (which happens only on Confluence) logged on the 'Global Users Management' screen.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a group
# Add 'Can Use' Confluence global permission to this group
# Create a user
# Add this user only to the recently created group above
fields.summary: Confluence login details not being recorded on JIRA

fields.description:
A user who received an email notification regarding a ticket update. Using sitename.atlassian.net, issue # ABC-123 as an example...when he clicks on the "Key" in the email, he is taken to this page: 

https://sitename.atlassian.net/i#browse/ABC-123?issueKey=ABC-123&serverRenderedViewIssue=true <https://sitename.atlassian.net/i#browse/ABC-123?issueKey=ABC-123%26serverRenderedViewIssue=true>

When that page opens, the ticket is not displayed. It looks like a default/blank search page.

I also noticed that if I open the URL he is directed to (https://sitename.atlassian.net/i#browse/ABC-123?issueKey=ABC-123&serverRenderedViewIssue=true)Internet Explorer resolves the URL and opens https://sitename.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-123.

We are both using IE 8. This problem does not happen when using Chrome.
fields.summary: IE 8 > Issue key in email notification displays permission violation message

fields.description:
Since Icebat 75.1 (JIRA 6.1-OD-08) creating a project in JIRA does not create any related content on linked applications. 

h5. Workaround

Administrators can still create Confluence space manually, and link it to corresponding JIRA project in the project configuration page. If there is any other problem, please contact support at https://support.atlassian.com.
fields.summary: Creating a project in JIRA does not create a Confluence space, a FishEye repository, a Crucible project and/or a Bamboo project.

In Firefox 26, the scroll bar is missing when viewing issues content.

See image attached.

fields.description: When I set the a workflow Post Function for the Resolve Issue transition to Update Issue Field *Remaining Estimate* to 0 it changes *Original Estimate* value to 0 instead. For scrum burndown, the original estimated time is compared to the remaining estimated time  to calculated the burndown. Of course, this can be done manually - but I am trying to put it in the workflow.
fields.summary: Workflow: Post Function - Update Issue Field Remaining Estimate to 0 changes Original Estimate Value

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:

* Create a project selecting the "Simple Issue Tracking" project type

* Create some issues

* Click on the avatar for that project.
!project.png!

* Click on "All open issues"
!all_open_issues.png!

* No issues are displayed, and an exclamation mark is displayed next to the "Open" Status.

!search.png!

This happens because Simple Issue tracking workflows don't have an "open" status for issues. There is a warning symbol beside Open and if you click on Open, then hover over the warning symbol in the dropdown you get the message "Status 'Open' is not valid..."

This link should probably search on status "To Do" for projects of Simple Issue Tracking type.
fields.summary: "All open issues" link on Simple Issue projects don't work as expected
Issue Collector replaces JQuery with version 1.2.6 instead of using available version (1.8.2)

fields.description:
The 'Assigned to Me' gadget is not correctly sorting the displayed issues when the selected column is the Project Name, ascending or descending.

Steps to reproduce:
* Add the 'Assigned to Me' gadget to a dashboard.
* Have some issues on different projects assigned to you.
* If the 'Project' column is not visible, add it.
* Click on 'Project' column name to sort by it
fields.summary: Assigned to Me gadget not sorting correctly by Project Name

fields.description:
If a user has access to 0 applications we'd expect them to see an error telling them so on login. Instead, we see one of two behaviours (haven't yet determined what causes one or the other):
1. The user gets a bad credentials error (see screenshot)
2. The user logs is presented with the dashboard with broken gadgets, and sees the correct error message when attempting to view an issue.
fields.summary: Users with access to no applications in HAUP do not get shown the expected error message

fields.description:
*Steps to produce*
# Create a new custom field (e.g: Text type) and make the field only available for one project context (e.g: project A)
# Create a new issue under project A, add a label to the issue (e.g: label-test);
# Go to the issue navigator, make sure the custom field configured earlier is configured to be shown on the issue navigator view.
# Run this JQL: {{labels = label-test}}, notice that the custom field is not yet shown since is an expected behavior.
# Click on the button next to *Basic*, choose *Detail View*.
# Change back to *List View*.


*Actual Results*
The custom field will appear on the issue navigator columns even though is not supposed to appear, if you refresh the page it will disappear again.


*Expected Results*
The custom field shouldn't be visible on the issue navigator.
fields.summary: Custom field is still shown on the issue navigator even though is not available within the project context

fields.description:
The e-mail addresses are not being updated in the assignee field in Issues. 

This purely a visual issue, though: the user gets notified on the updated email address.
fields.summary: After changing the email address, it remains unchanged in 'assignee' field.

fields.description:
In the previous JIRA releases (OnDemand 6.0-OD-07.2 for instance) the Update Issue Field worked differently from the new JIRA version (6.0-OD-09-3 for instance).

In 'old' JIRA:

!fireball-205_1.png!

in 'new' JIRA:

!fireball-208_1.png!

Also, in the 'old' JIRA, when choosing the Automatic Assignee in the post function configuration

{noformat}
The Assignee of the issue will be set to -1. 
{noformat}

The issue would be assigned to the default assignee of the project. 

In 'new' JIRA, the assignee actually becomes *-1*:

!fireball-208_3.png!

Now, in 'old' JIRA, choosing Unassigned on the post function configuration:

{noformat}
The Assignee of the issue will be cleared.
{noformat}

The issue would be left as Unassigned when the transition was executed. 

In 'new' JIRA, the issue has no Assignee:

!fireball-208_2.png!
fields.summary: Change of behavior in the Update Issue Field post function

fields.description:
When a customer creates a new ondemand instance including greenhopper or adds greenhopper to a current ondemand instance the plugin doesn't show up and the agile dropdown doesn't either.

Fix: manually upload greenhopper plugin
fields.summary: Greenhopper plugin is not appearing

fields.description:
When generating a new user without password and send them an email for notifying them.
The button in the email (named "set my password") is not linked to the set password link. It only takes the user to the login screen, it tries to browse to the user profile. This causes confusion for the users.

Below the links from the email:

* Button  
** ==>  https://xxx.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa
* Link "request a new password"  
** ==>  https://xxx.atlassian.net/secure/ForgotLoginDetails.jspa?username=<username>
fields.summary: Set password button in mail notification not working for Jira OnDemand

fields.description:
If an issue has sub-task/s, the sub-task/s statues names does not appear on the main issue details (within the 'Sub-tasks' section).
Only the sub-task's status image is displayed. Although if you hover the mouse over the sub-tasks' status image, the name of the status will appear as a "text box".
fields.summary: Sub-task's status name does not appear on main task details

fields.description:
h3. Description
This might be a corner use case but it's terribly frustrating.

The administrator interface for Jira onDemand to create full instance backups only allows backup up every 48 hours. However, when a backup is completed and stored in WebDav, it is only stored for 24 hours.

In my case I had a backup created in the background and forgot about it for the rest of the day. When I went back to retrieve the backup it was more than 24 hours after the backup was completed and the file was gone. But it is not possible for me to create a new backup.
fields.summary: Can only backup every 48 hours but backups are only retained for 24h in AOD/JOD

fields.description:
Type an issue key that doesn't exist into quick search. An error is shown but the filters list is also shown over the application navigator.

!filters.png!
fields.summary: Filters bar displayed over app navigator

fields.description:
h4. Problem

When doing a JIRA Import, on the UI screen the reindex gets stuck for hours in the same reindex %. In the logs we see many:

{noformat}... /secure/admin/StudioImport!import.jspa [atlassian.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder] Indexing failed for Issue - '15519'
.../secure/admin/StudioImport!import.jspa [atlassian.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder] java.nio.channels.ClosedByInterruptException
{noformat} until it stucks there for hours.

This may not affect all imports.

h4. Workaround

Contact [Support|https://support.atlassian.com] who will restart the instance, do a full reindex and finish the import manually if it had attachments, logos and avatars.
fields.summary: Import gets stuck reindexing while doing the Magic Potions after a successful import

fields.description:
When using the Share Issue feature, there are 2 different behaviors that depend on whether or not you have entered a comment.

If you added a comment, the email received by everyone includes said comment and a link to the shared issue.

If you did not add a comment, the email shows a blank box with no link to the shared issue.

In both cases, the title of the email allows people to track said issue since you have the name and ID but the lack of a direct link is annoying.
fields.summary: Sharing an issue without adding a comment will not provide a link to the issue

fields.description:
Once you login to JIRA OnDemand After the new update to JIRA 6.1, the Do not show tick box is not remembered, and the dialog keeps showing in every new page. 

h5. Workaround

Atlassian Support can disable the plugin responsible for that dialog box.
fields.summary: "What's new in 6.1" Do Not Show again preference not remembered

fields.description:
I noticed while creating a custom field that the page reads:

"You can find more useful custom field types at the Atlassian Plugin Exchange."

This is misleading for OnDemand users, who are unable to install plugins from the Plugin Exchange.
fields.summary: The Create Custom Field admin page directs OnDemand users to the Plugin Exchange

fields.description:
I tried to create a new status to go along with some workflow changes and was unable to do so. When trying to create the status I was taken to a 500 error page stating that creating the status was violating a pk uniqueness constraint in the DB (error report attached).

*Steps to Reproduce:*
1. Login to JIRA OnDemand instance as an admin
2. Go to the Status Administration page
3. Attempt to create a new status 

*Expected Behavior:* Status is successfully created, it is use-able in new workflows, a general sense of happiness and productivity is experienced by all involved parties.

*Obtained Behavior:* After hitting the "Add" button I am immediately taken to an error page that produces the attached error log
fields.summary: Unable To Create New Status' in JIRA OnDemand Instance

fields.description:
Occasionally we run into customers complaining that they do not receive notifications from their instance anymore. In several cases we have found out that the outgoing mail server was disabled. We have not been able to find out WHY it had been disabled.

If you disable the outgoing mail manually, you will see the following line pop up in the access_log.
{noformat}/secure/admin/DisableOutgoingMail.jspa?atl_token=BA5K-BTOS-Z92L-H4OB|28b6e2eeb6ead0147d2e1e5d6ef7045af80974fa|lin HTTP/1.0" 302 20 7511 "https://xxxxx-xxxxxx.atlassian.net/secure/admin/OutgoingMailServers.jspa" "Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.17 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/24.0.1312.69 Safari/537.17"{noformat}

I have investigated further and have not been able to find any other log entries which might indicate the mail server has been turned off. Perhaps it doesn't start up after a deployment or something, though I have not been able to find data that supports this.
fields.summary: Outgoing mail disabled unexpectedly

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Log in to a user account that has a dashboard shared with them (but not owned by them).
# Go to Dashboards > Manage Dashboards, click "Create new dashboard".
# In the "Start From" dropdown, that shared dashboard doesn't show.

However, if you load up the shared dashboard first then go to Tools > Copy Dashboard, the "Start From" dropdown is pre-populated with the shared dashboard name.

It should to be possible to create a new dashboard from an existing one by either method.
fields.summary: Manage Dashboards > Create New Dashboard doesn't show dashboards that are shared with you

fields.description:
h5.Summary

Creating a new account is not possible for public signup in JIRA.

h5.Steps to Reproduce 

- Click on *Create new account*
- You will be directed to the *Sign up* form
- Captcha is not shown, hence users can't key in a correct captcha in order to signup

h5.Workaround
Disable the feature altogether: go to *JIRA Admin > System > General Configuration* and set the _CAPTCHA on signup_ option to OFF.
fields.summary: Captcha on JIRA public signup is broken

fields.description:
When the {{ka.AJAX_VIEW_ISSUE}} dark feature is set on an instance, choosing "Attach Screenshot" from the "More Actions" button on the View Issue page will result in pop-up window with an invalid URL.

The invalid URL looks like
* {{https://<hostname>/secure/AttachScreenshot!default.jspa?id=\{0\}&returnUrl=/secure/issues&decorator=popup}}

So the '\{0\}' has not been replaced. This effectively prevents customers from being able to use this feature.

Turning off the dark feature (which cannot be done by customers) restores this functionality.  To do so, remove the ka.AJAX_VIEW_ISSUE from enabled dark features in the Advanced settings.
fields.summary: Dark feature 'ka.AJAX_VIEW_ISSUE' enabled for many OnDemand instances prevents 'Attach Screenshot' link from working
JIRA not showing the top navigation bar after the August 12 OnDemand maintenance

fields.description:
Users are experiencing issues when creating new projects in JIRA OnDemand.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Click Projects > Create Project from the main navigation. This brings up the Select Project Type screen.

2. Select a project type (e.g. Simple Issue Tracking) and click Next.

3. Complete the wizard steps (including providing the project name, key, and lead) and hit Submit.

h3. Result

* The Simple Issue Tracking screen remains up indefinitely with an activity indicator spinning next to the Back button.
* Navigating to the Projects administration page lists the new project but clicking the link (or browsing to it using the /browse/KEY convention) results in the Project Does Not Exist error. Similarly, browsing to the individual project administration tab (/plugins/servlet/project-config/KEY) results in an error message.
* Trying to delete the project results in the Project Does Not Exist error.

h3. Workaround

Raise a support ticket at [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com] under *OnDemand Support* to have your JIRA instance restarted.
fields.summary: Unable to access/delete new projects

fields.description:
The behaviour has been reported so far in Firefox, IE ad Chrome on the Windows and Chrome & Firefox on OSX.

Video attached of the click not extending the JQL query with ASC or DESC when expected.

No errors are generated within the log when the behaviour occurs.

I've also attached the developer Tools view which displays the following briefly when the event occurs:
{noformat}onselectstart="return false;" unselectable="on"{noformat}

*Workaround*
Manually adding the 'ORDER BY' argument does work.  The behaviour does not always occur.
